channel.title: Public boolean not recognized?

item.title: Public boolean not recognized?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

pk2play:

Did you make sure you imported properly?

You’re an idiot.

He’s trying to use a method as a variable.

Also, you don’t need an “else” in those methods.

public boolean isInArena() {
    return (absX >= 2590 && absX <= 2602 && absY >= 8480 && absY <=9510) ? true : false;
}

item.title: Public boolean not recognized?
item.dc:creator: @staticfish1 staticfish1
item.description:
@staticfish1 wrote:

Ok I declared this under isInArena and I’m still getting this error when I compile, even though it recognizes isInWR?

client.java:15232: cannot find symbol symbol : variable IsInNZ location: class client IsInNZ = true; ^ client.java:15250: cannot find symbol symbol : variable IsInNZ location: class client if(PlayerHandler.nznpc == 5 && IsInNZ && PlayerHandler.npcnz == 5){ ^ client.java:15251: cannot find symbol symbol : variable IsInNZ location: class client IsInNZ = false; ^

Even though I declared it here

public boolean isInArena() {
	if((absX >= 2590 && absX <= 2602 && absY >= 8480 && absY <=9510))
	return true;
	else
	return false;
	}
public boolean isInWR() {  
        if((absX >= 3120 && absX <= 3125 && absY >= 3354 && absY <=3360))
        return true;
        else
        return false;
        }
public boolean isInNZ() {
        if((absX >= 3091 && absX <= 3118 && absY >= 3354 && absY <= 3374))
        return true;
        else
        return false;
        }

Read full topic
